lines.content: Duke is a Personal Assistant Chatbot that helps you to keep track of various things via Command Line Interface (CLI).
1. Ensure you have Java 11 or above installed in your computer.
3. Open your terminal and `cd` into the folder where `Duke.jar` exists.
4. Once you are in the correct folder, run this command `java -jar Duke.jar` to run Duke.
If the setup is correct, you should see the below as the output when you run Duke for the first time:
What can I do for you?
☹ OOPS!!! The file does not exist. Creating a new file.
Now your data will be saved in the file. Please proceed!
In future usage of Duke, you can expect to see this instead:
What can I do for you?
Add a todo to task list. A todo is a task that does not have any
date or time attached to it.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 tasks in the list.
Add a deadline to task list. A deadline is a task that has a specific due date.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Add an event to task list. An event is a task that that starts at a specific
date or time and ends at a specific date or time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
List all the tasks in the current task list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
Delete a task from task list by specifying the task number in the list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Mark a task as done by specifying the task number in the list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Mark a task as not done by specifying the task number in the list.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Find a task in the list by providing a keyword that matches the
task description or part of it.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
Bye. Hope to see you again soon! :)
* Represents the Duke chatbot. Allows user to utilise features such as loading
* and saving their data in every instance of Duke, listing tasks, finding
* specific tasks, marking and unmarking tasks, deleting tasks, as well as adding
* three different types of tasks : To-do, Deadline or Event.
* Creates new Ui, Storage and Parser objects.
* Greets the user and loads data from text file at the start of the program.
* Handles user commands until user exits the program.
* When user exits program, saves current task list inside text file and says bye.
* Represents a parser that parses the user's commands to make sense of
* what the user wants to do.
* Constructs new TaskList and UI objects to be used to handle appropriate
* task operations based on the user's commands.
* Interprets user commands by checking the first word of the user input.
* Checks whether user command is List, Find, Mark, Unmark, Delete, To-do,
* Deadline or Event and calls the appropriate method to handle the command.
* Handles unidentified commands by giving the user a message.
String[] input = command.split(" ", 2); //only check the first word
* Represents a Storage object that handles the loading of data from text file and
* saving of data into text file.
* Loads the data from the text file when Duke starts up and writes the
* existing data into the list of tasks.
* @throws FileNotFoundException when the text file "data/duke.txt" is
* Attempts to load the data from the text file into the list of tasks.
* Attempts to create the text file for the user if it is not found.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! The file does not exist. Creating a new file.");
System.out.println("Now your data will be saved in the file. Please proceed!");
System.out.println("Error while creating the file. Your data won't be saved :(");
* Saves the tasks in the current list of tasks automatically whenever
* a new change is made to the task list. Ensures that user's data is
* saved even if the program crashes.
* Converts data from inside the text file into a Task object before
* loading the data into the task list.
* @param str Task to be loaded from text file into task list.
Character c = task[0].charAt(0); //check if task is a To-do, Deadline or Event
Character marked = task[1].charAt(1); //check if task is marked done or not
Task t = new Event(description, duration[0], duration[1]);
* Converts a task from inside the task list into the correct format for
* saving the task in the text file.
* @param t Task to be saved from task list into text file.
Character c = str.charAt(1); //check if task is a To-do, Deadline or Event
Character marked = str.charAt(4); //check if task is marked done or not
* Represents the task list and has operations to list tasks, find tasks,
* mark and unmark tasks, delete tasks and add To-dos, Deadlines and Events.
* Constructs new Storage object to handle saving of data into
* text file and new Ui object to handle some error messages.
* Prints out each task in the list of tasks.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("Looks like your list is still empty");
* Finds a task by searching list of tasks for a keyword.
* Prints out all tasks with descriptions that contain the keyword.
System.out.println("Here are the matching tasks in your list:");
System.out.println("I couldn't find any matching tasks :(");
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! Keyword is missing. Please try again by giving me a keyword to look for.");
System.out.println("Nice! I've marked this task as done:");
* Marks a task as not done.
System.out.println("OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Deletes a task from the list of tasks.
System.out.println("Now you have " + Task.taskCount + " tasks in the list.");
* Adds a To-do object to the list of tasks.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + Task.taskCount + " tasks in the list.");
* Adds a Deadline object to the list of tasks.
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + Task.taskCount + " tasks in the list.");
* Adds an Event object to the list of tasks.
Task t = new Event(start[0], end[0], end[1] );
System.out.println("Got it. I've added this task:");
System.out.println("Now you have " + Task.taskCount + " tasks in the list.");
* Represents messages printed by Duke for interactions with the user.
* Greets the user at the start of the program.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Bids the user farewell when they exit the program.
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon! :)");
* Prints a message to the user when the user command is unidentified.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means.");
* Prints error message when NumberFormatException is caught when attempting to
* mark a task as done or undone, or while deleting a task.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! Task number is invalid. Please try again.");
* Prints error message when IndexOutOfBoundsException is caught when attempting to
* mark a task as done or undone, or while deleting a task.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! Task number is missing. Please try again. ");
* Prints error message when DukeException is caught when attempting to
* mark a task as done or undone, or while deleting a task.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! You entered an invalid task number. Please try again.");
* Prints error message when there is a missing task description for a To-do, Deadline
* or Event task or a missing attribute such as the due date for a Deadline or a start
* and end date/time for an Event.
System.out.println("☹ OOPS!!! There's something missing in your task description.");
* Prints out the correct format for adding a To-do task.
* Prints out the correct format for adding a Deadline task.
System.out.println("Please follow this format: deadline [description] /by [due date/time]");
* Prints out the correct format for adding an Event task.
* Represents a type of task that has a due date, which is indicated by
* Constructs a Deadline object that inherits from Task object, assigns the due date of task.
* @param description The description of the deadline.
* @param by The due date of the deadline.
* Prints Deadline object in a specific format.
* @return A string representing the Deadline object.
* Represents an exception that is specific to the Duke chatbot.
* Represents a type of task that starts at a specific date/time and ends
* at a specific date/time. The start and end date/time are indicated by
* the user, by the delimiters "/from" and "/to".
* Constructs an Event object that inherits from Task object, assigns the
* start and end date and/or time of task.
* @param description The description of the deadline.
* @param start The start date/time of the deadline.
* @param end The end date/time of the deadline.
public Event(String description, String start, String end) {
* Prints Event object in a specific format.
* @return A string representing the Event object.
* Represents file operations such as writing and appending to a file.
* Writes a specific string to the file specified by the file path.
* @param filePath The file path which specifies which file to write to.
* @param textToAdd The string that is to be written into the file
* @throws IOException if the file specified by the file path is not found.
public static void writeToFile(String filePath, String textToAdd) throws IOException {

* @param filePath The file path which specifies which file to append to.
* @param textToAppend The string that is to be appended into the file
* @throws IOException if the file specified by the file path is not found.
public static void appendToFile(String filePath, String textToAppend) throws IOException {
* Represents a Task that contains attributes like the task description and
* an indication of whether the task has been completed.
public static ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>(); //keep a collection of tasks
public static int taskCount = 0; //keep track of number of tasks

* @param description The description of the task.
* Prints Task object in a specific format.
* @return A string representing the Task object.
* Gets the Status Icon of the task object by checking the isDone field.
* @return Marks the Task with an "X" if it has been completed
* and with a whitespace character " " otherwise.
* Sets the isDone attribute of a task to true to indicate that the task
* Sets the isDone attribute of a task to false to indicate that the task

* Constructs a To-do object that inherits from Task object.
* @param description The description of the to-do.
* Prints To-do object in a specific format.
* @return A string representing the To-do object.
